title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in the integrated development environment (IDE), the context for nested classes is not correctly identified. This results in the 'Enclosing Type' field being blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
OB: With build 20011106, when a .java file is open in the editor and the new class button is clicked, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
EB: Build 20011106. With a .java file open in the editor, when clicking the new class button, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open the IDE with build 20011106.
2. Open a .java file in the editor.
3. Click on the new class button.
4. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field.
